## UnicodeUtils namespace

Namespace containing useful information when dealing with Unicode's code points.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare namespace UnicodeUtils 
```

## Enumerations

|  Enumeration | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [Direction](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.direction.md) | Unicode code point direction. |

## Functions

|  Function | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [getDirection(codePoint, block)](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.getdirection.md) | Returns the Unicode's character direction. |
|  [isNewLine(codePoint)](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.isnewline.md) | Checks if a character should be considered as a new line. |
|  [isPrintable(codePoint)](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.isprintable.md) | Checks if a character's can be printed (rendered). |
|  [isRtlMirrored(codePoint)](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.isrtlmirrored.md) | Checks if a character should be mirrored on an RTL run. |
|  [isWhiteSpace(codePoint)](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.iswhitespace.md) | Checks if a character should be considered as a white space. |

## Variables

|  Variable | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [neutralBidirectionalRanges](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.neutralbidirectionalranges.md) | ASCII punctuation is considered to have neutral direction: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic\_Latin\_(Unicode\_block)\#Table\_of\_characters |
|  [newLineRanges](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.newlineranges.md) | Range of Unicode code points considered as <code>NewLine</code>. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newline\#Unicode |
|  [nonPrintableRanges](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.nonprintableranges.md) | Range of Unicode code points considered as non-printable. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unicode\_control\_characters |
|  [rtlBlocks](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.rtlblocks.md) | Unicode Blocks which have inherent RTL direction. These blocks correspond to the scripts described here: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Right-to-left\#List\_of\_RTL\_scripts |
|  [rtlMirroredCodePoints](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.rtlmirroredcodepoints.md) | Some punctuation characters (like: (, ), &lt;<!-- -->, &gt;<!-- -->, \[,\], {<!-- -->, }<!-- -->) need to be mirrored when rendering a RTL string to preserve their intrinsic meaning. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic\_Latin\_(Unicode\_block)\#Table\_of\_characters |
|  [weakBidirectionalRanges](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.weakbidirectionalranges.md) | Latin and arabic numerals are considered to have weak directionality: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basic\_Latin\_(Unicode\_block)\#Table\_of\_characters https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabic\_(Unicode\_block)\#Block |
|  [whiteSpaceRanges](./harp-text-canvas.unicodeutils.whitespaceranges.md) | Range of Unicode code points considered as white space. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whitespace\_character |
